main event: On February 6, 1955, multiple witnesses observed a circular object with a bright reflection over New Orleans, Louisiana, which took off at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar at high speed estimated to be approximately 1,500 mph., The weather was clear with unlimited visibility., Witnesses reported seeing a yellowish orange light that was moving and wavering., This incident was reported by both Air Traffic Control and several civilian observers., The object was observed for a total of about 4 to 5 minutes before disappearing from view.
sighted object: a circular object with a bright reflection
witness description: Various civilians and air traffic control personnel.
